item.title: Pothole on exit of the car park, 16th January
item.description:
I am writing to report a serious pothole located at the exit of Choumert Grove car park. This pothole has been present for more than three months and has not been repaired despite posing a clear danger to vehicles. The hole is very deep and is causing damage to tyres and vehicle suspension systems. Several drivers, including myself, have been affected, and the condition of the road presents an ongoing safety risk. I would appreciate it if this matter could be treated as urgent and repaired as soon as possible to prevent further damage and potential accidents. Please confirm when the repair will be carried out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Choumert Grove, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 sets of Dangerous Cracked Paving at 5/6/7 Gillison Walk, 16th January
item.description:
I have been reporting this for over 2 months, every time your reply is 'Sent to Highways'. It is still not fixed. This is a narrow cut- through to Bermondsey Jubilee Line Stn. It is well- used and very dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Gillison Walk, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Wooden TV dumped near row of bins + general rubbish scattered all over the pavement, 16th January
item.description:
So the location of where this mess is happens to be bullace Row Se5 7hj just off camberwell road it's a common location that's always getting cleaned up then days later more rubbish is created but this there is a TV stand that was taken from another location plus general rubbish bin bags etc just scattered all over the side walk and may I also mention after a brief encounter today I spotted the sighting of a rat so it's clear this mess is attracting rodents aka rats
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bullace Row, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped large white chest on street, 16th January
item.description:

item.title: Recylcing bins 4 - 24 Lime Row, 16th January
item.description:
The recycling steel pods x2 paper and card and 1 each for different coloured glass are overflowing and have not been emptied. In total there are 5 pods that are overflowing and have not been emptied for at least 2 months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4-7, Lime Row, Lower Belvedere, Erith, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, recycling bags broken and spilling, 16th January
item.description:
Unused food waste containers, recycling put out in the rain the day after collection day and now foxes have gone through. Dumped furniture not paid for through bulk collection. Depressing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rowhill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raw meat littering path to gates, 16th January
item.description:
Found pieces of raw meat littering the area heading upto mine and my neighbours garden gates. This is the third time I have found raw meat in this area, which is used by a lot of the cats in the area to get through to the gardens. possible poison attempt!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holly Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street covered in litter, 16th January
item.description:
Another week gone by and Woodhill has still not been swept. It has now been months and the road has litter everywhere. Please clean our street!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Woodhill, Woolwich
